duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide direct Physical Therapy services to patients and demonstrate progression of treatment plans and implementation of appropriate therapeutic interventions.
Collaborate with physicians, patients, family, and other members of the health care team for patient treatment and progress, as well as effective discharge planning.
Act as a preceptor and mentor for new staff therapists, students, and rehabilitation aides. Train in advanced and/or specialized treatment tools and techniques.
Support leadership and department initiatives, participate in department quality assessment and improvement strategies, and contribute to program development as assigned.

Demonstrate proper use and maintenance of department equipment and supplies, attend and participate in departmental meetings, in-services, rounds, and peer reviews, and engage in continuing education programs for professional competency.
Meet physical and non-physical job demands as outlined, assume other duties and responsibilities appropriate to the position and area.

education_certification.credential: Four-year Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Physical Therapy (Graduate or professional work or advanced degree preferred)
License to practice Physical Therapy in the state of Texas (Required)
Basic Life Support for Healthcare Providers as required by CP 1.20 Life Support Course Requirements (Required)
